Messages.Author: Behnam Zamani Gharehchaman
Messages.Content: Dear all, As our regular room in H-Building will not be available for our class tomorrow (12 Jun), we will hold our class in the Seminar room of our department in the KF building. So please come to the room KF 218 tomorrow. You will find the room on the second (2.5) floor (entrance right in the main staircase of the KF building). The campus map can be found here. See you tomorrow in KF218! B.Zamani

Messages.Author: Behnam Zamani Gharehchaman
Messages.Content: Dear all, The slides of the presentations in our first two sessions are now uploaded onto ISIS page of LIM. Please note that, as I was not able to get the permission for some copyrighted material from our two book sources, I have put their figure/table numbers instead of the figures and tables themselves (in green boxes). So, if you need, you can refer to those books and see the figures.  Follow-up of our discussion on evapotranspiration (session 2):  For more information on the measurement of Evapotranspiration in large plants/tress (using the lysimeter system), please refer to the following links:  https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lysimeter#:~:text=A%20lysimeter%20(from%20Greek%20%CE%BB%CF%8D%CF%83%CE%B9%CF%82,and%20material%20through%20the%20soil. https://www.bmel.de/DE/themen/landwirtschaft/pflanzenbau/bodenschutz/lysimeter.html Best regards, B. Zamani

Messages.Author: Behnam Zamani Gharehchaman
Messages.Content: Dear students, Welcome to the Lecture "Introduction to Limnology" (LIM). I would like to give you some initial information about the beginning of our course. The lecture will be held basically in presence. However, we will have some of our sessions online via Zoom or Webex. I will adjust these online sessions with you in advance. The presentations (and other presented materials) will be uploaded here at ISIS weekly after each session and will remain available throughout the semester. The Course language is English, and the lectures will be held in English. The sources and learning materials, as well as your final presentation will also be in English. Individual meetings and discussions can be held both in English and German. For our first session, we will be meeting as follows: First session: Wednesday 17 April, 14:00-15:30 Room: H 0111 We will discuss more details about the structure and organization of the lecture in the first session. See you on Wednesday! Best regards Behnam Zamani
